meta.description: Index of all Mycelium RFCs. Each RFC is a self-contained design document that builds on previous RFCs.

rfc_sequence.title: Project Structure & Crate Architecture
rfc_sequence.summary: Defines the cargo workspace layout, crate boundaries, and coding conventions for the Mycelium CLI.

rfc_sequence.title: Cryptographic Primitives Layer
rfc_sequence.summary: Specifies the crypto primitive wrappers: ChaCha20-Poly1305 AEAD, X25519 key agreement, Ed25519 signatures, HKDF, BLAKE3 hashing, and zeroization requirements.

rfc_sequence.title: Core Data Model & Serialization
rfc_sequence.summary: Defines the domain types: Org, Project, SecretSet, Version, Device, Member, and their serialization formats.

rfc_sequence.title: Device Identity & Local Key Storage
rfc_sequence.summary: Specifies device keypair generation (Ed25519 + X25519), secure local storage, profile system, and GitHub OAuth binding.

rfc_sequence.title: GitHub Backend Protocol
rfc_sequence.summary: Defines how Mycelium leverages GitHub as the complete backend: repository storage, GitHub API for operations, OAuth for auth, and Actions OIDC for CI.

rfc_sequence.title: Envelope Encryption & PDK Lifecycle
rfc_sequence.summary: Specifies Project Data Key (PDK) generation, wrapping PDKs to device pubkeys, unwrapping, and the versioned PDK model.

rfc_sequence.title: Secret Set Encryption & Versioning
rfc_sequence.summary: Defines how secret sets are encrypted with PDKs, version numbering, content-addressable storage, and integrity verification.

rfc_sequence.title: Membership & Access Control
rfc_sequence.summary: Specifies roles (owner, admin, member, reader), membership mutations, and how PDK wrappers are managed per-member.

rfc_sequence.title: Key Rotation & Revocation
rfc_sequence.summary: Defines PDK rotation on membership removal, device revocation, forward secrecy guarantees, and rotation audit records.

rfc_sequence.title: CLI Architecture & Command Surface
rfc_sequence.summary: Specifies the myc CLI structure, subcommand taxonomy, profile switching, output formats (human/JSON), and exit codes.

rfc_sequence.title: GitHub Actions CI Integration
rfc_sequence.summary: Defines GitHub Actions OIDC-based authentication for CI workflows. Workflows can pull secrets without stored credentials.

rfc_sequence.title: Audit Log & Integrity Verification
rfc_sequence.summary: Specifies the signed audit log format, BLAKE3 hash chaining, tamper detection, and compliance export.

rfc_sequence.title: Key Recovery & Account Continuity
rfc_sequence.summary: Defines multi-device enrollment, recovery contacts, and optional Shamir-split org recovery key for when users lose their devices.

rfc_sequence.title: CLI User Experience & Quick Start
rfc_sequence.summary: Defines the 5-minute quick start, shell completions, .myc.yaml project config, subprocess injection, and actionable error messages.

future_rfcs.title: GitHub Organizations & Teams Integration
future_rfcs.summary: Leverage GitHub Organizations and Teams for membership management, mapping GitHub team membership to Mycelium project access.

future_rfcs.title: GitHub Webhooks & Notifications
future_rfcs.summary: Use GitHub webhooks for real-time notifications on secret changes, rotation events, and membership updates.

future_rfcs.title: Cross-Repository Secret Sharing
future_rfcs.summary: Share encrypted secrets across multiple GitHub repositories within an organization.
